values.description:
Issue #130

This bug was the cause of the boost lock segfault within ros sleep when using the gazebo_ros_api_plugin system plugin.

values.description: Added DOC_ONLY and PACKAGE_SOURCE_ONLY cmake variables that cause the configuration step to bail out early, before performing checks for system prerequisites (issue #27). That way CI jobs that build docs or make tarballs don't have to install everything that's needed to actually compile Gazebo. Actual changes are minor; mostly pulling some stuff up to the front of the configure run.
values.title: Add DOC_ONLY and PACKAGE_SOURCE_ONLY cmake variables

summary.raw: Added DOC_ONLY and PACKAGE_SOURCE_ONLY cmake variables that cause the configuration step to bail out early, before performing checks for system prerequisites (issue #27). That way CI jobs that build docs or make tarballs don't have to install everything that's needed to actually compile Gazebo. Actual changes are minor; mostly pulling some stuff up to the front of the configure run.
summary.html: Added DOC_ONLY and PACKAGE_SOURCE_ONLY cmake variables that cause the configuration step to bail out early, before performing checks for system prerequisites (issue #27). That way CI jobs that build docs or make tarballs don't have to install everything that's needed to actually compile Gazebo. Actual changes are minor; mostly pulling some stuff up to the front of the configure run.

values.description: Added query for OGRE's plugindir variable, which is defined in its .pc file. This allows us to remove the Ubuntu-specific hacks regarding finding OGRE and its library/plugin directories. As far as I can tell, OGRE.pc should always have the right values for libdir and plugindir.   Fixes #138
values.title: Fix OGRE plugindir determination

summary.raw: Added query for OGRE's plugindir variable, which is defined in its .pc file. This allows us to remove the Ubuntu-specific hacks regarding finding OGRE and its library/plugin directories. As far as I can tell, OGRE.pc should always have the right values for libdir and plugindir.   Fixes #138
summary.html: Added query for OGRE's plugindir variable, which is defined in its .pc file. This allows us to remove the Ubuntu-specific hacks regarding finding OGRE and its library/plugin directories. As far as I can tell, OGRE.pc should always have the right values for libdir and plugindir. Fixes #138

values.title: Make cppcheck and cpplint output Jenkins-friendly files.

values.description:
consolidate GetWallTime() calls

fixed "Time divide by zero" warnings when starting gazebo.

fixed throttle with offsets and clock latency.

made clock resolution parameter static, checked during construction of Time class.
values.title: new Time::NSleep() call.  Sleep will check to see if timer resolution is smaller than the requested sleep, and skip sleep if otherwise.  This should solve the problem where system with scpi disabled using large clock resolutions are not able to run faster

summary.raw:
consolidate GetWallTime() calls

fixed "Time divide by zero" warnings when starting gazebo.

fixed throttle with offsets and clock latency.

made clock resolution parameter static, checked during construction of Time class.
summary.html:
consolidate GetWallTime() calls

fixed "Time divide by zero" warnings when starting gazebo.

fixed throttle with offsets and clock latency.

made clock resolution parameter static, checked during construction of Time class.

values.title: Removed verbatim from proto files.

summary.html:
I ran these two commands on only the .proto files in gazebo/msgs directory

find . -name "*.proto" -exec sed -i -e 's/\/\/\/ \endverbatim//g' {} \;

find . -name "*.proto" -exec sed -i -e 's/\/\/\/ \verbatim//g' {} \;

values.reason: Thanks Ian. This is almost the right solution. It would be better to put the threading capability in the ModelDatabase itself so that any client gets the benefit. I'm declining this pull request, and will submit a new one in a few minutes.
